New Records: Malik Monk scored 31 points in the Sacramento Kings' 138-133 win over the Grizzlies
Key Match Events: The Kings led 78-72 at halftime and 102-100 after three quarters
The Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead on Scottie Pippen Jr.'s two free throws at the 7:56 mark of the fourth quarter
The Kings went on a 20-10 run to regain the lead capped with a 3-pointer by Monk with 4:21 remaining
Pre-Game Insights: Ja Morant (right AC joint strain) and Marcus Smart (right index finger) did not play for the Grizzlies
Keegan Murray missed his second straight game for the Kings (left ankle soreness)
Kings guard Devin Carter, the son of Grizzlies assistant coach Anthony Carter, made his debut with the team in the first quarter
Post-Match Reflections: Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and had nine points and seven rebounds off the bench
The Kings won their third in a row
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams combined for 150 points in the first half
The Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%)
The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter
